Reviews.Title: “Great staff, badly designed”
Reviews.Author: sally_and_bill_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel have wonderful helpful and friendly staff. But they should fire their architect/ interior designer. The rooms were very poorly designed. The beds were hard, no place to even hang a towel. The staff say: welcome; the room-design says: go away. The downstairs lobby looks like the waiting room for a morgue. Rooms are however spotlessly clean. Linen lovely and crisp.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: mwall722
Reviews.Content: First impression of this room was 5 star all the way, but after living in it for a few nights, I have to bump it down to 4. I am an engineer, but appreciate good looking design. This place is definitely designed for form and not function, this is evident mostly in the bathroom. The ultra modern shower made it difficult to take a shower. Ha, there was also a shade covering a completely transparent window between the shower and living room. The kicker is that the shade is operated from the living room, where the window looks out to... I guess you have to trust your roommate! The thing that most surprised me was how large the room was. Maybe I've gotten used to European rooms, but the make pretty good use of the 35 square meter superior double room. We also had issues with our A/C, however the staff addressed it right away, and it was a little better after that, but still not frigid like some places I've stayed. The location is great, we walked into the city several times but also took the Metro (about a minute from Diego de Leon). The staff is very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again, however there isn't a pool which was a bummer in Madrid in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room - great for a family”
Reviews.Author: A2ZNJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a very nice & quiet area of the city - but convenient to get around using the Metro just around the corner. The room was modern & spacious. The front desk staff was very helpful with directions and recommendations. We enjoyed our stay very much and would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: eddieluda
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days, received excellent service from the front desk attendants, enjoyed the spacious room with mini-kitchen, internet, etc. Only one block from metro entrance, outstanding location for seeing all the sights of Madrid. A special thanks to Juan Gonzales for his assistance in allowing us the 2nd 3 days of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean modern room”
Reviews.Author: Mathijn
Reviews.Content: We got à free upgrade to à superior room, which was a nice and spacious room: large bed and a good place to sit. It even had a microwave, coffeemachine and some other kitchen stuff. In room internet was for free and fast. The choice in minibar is limited, but it is for free; how nice. The location is great, it is just a 2 minute walk to the metrostation (take exit c. De Leon). The bed was à bit hard... Can't say anything about the breakfast as we decided to book the room w/o breakfast and we enjoyed our morning coffee in one of the several bars near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value”
Reviews.Author: elestoban
Reviews.Content: Not sure what the rack rate is - we booked through hotels.com & paid 85 euros - when we saw the room we almost felt guilty about how little we had paid. For us the location is perfect but probably wouldn't be ideal for most overseas tourists. Wished we had been here for longer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, good location and big clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: luladeNicaragua
Reviews.Content: Well located near a lot of restaurants and shops in Serrano. Near metro

Reviews.Title: “OK but a bit dated and nothing particularly special”
Reviews.Author: Catters1402
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK but not really worth the great reviews it has in my opinion. The location is good if you need to be in Salamanca, not so good if you want to be in the very centre for shopping and tourism. Reception is fine, although all a bit 70's, rooms the same - nice and big but not luxurious - furniture is all plastic really. Nice big beds, bathrooms dated, big old TVs and most notably DREADFUL room service - I paid 7.50 Euros for a sandwich mixto which consisted of two slices of stale cold white sliced bread, a piece of plastic cheese and ham on a dirty plate wihout even a slice of tomato as a garnish - so bad it prompted me to write my first trip advisor review!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: chaiWindsor
Reviews.Content: Following a long trip arround spain in various locations and some rather poor hotels, El Madrono was a welcome plus. The staff were polite and friendly, another think sadly lacking in the other hotels. The room although showing their age were clean and adequate. the room service has a good variety. Parking was reasonable for the centre of Madrid. Overall very good.

Reviews.Title: “excelent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boogy_RO
Reviews.Content: very very nice hotel with excelent service. anything you need you get it. I've stayed for 2 weeks on a business trip to Madrid and I was extremly sattisfied with the hotel. A perfect location if you are on a business trip, near the business centers and reasonably close to the city main turist atraction (if i recall corectly there are 6 metro station to the Opera Station, and the metro is very close to the hotel, 5 minutes walk. the area is very quiet, you have some coffe shops and a fruit store just around the corner and a Burger King is also near, but you will not need all of that if you choose to have the continental breakfast at the hotel. Also the tea from the breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: dakesale
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded expectations. Room excellent. Staff helpful. Breakfast great. Only downside is that it is away from Centro, but metro is close and the best service of any city I have visited.1 Also is within 400 meters of Bus Station for the airport 1 euro charge!
